name: Olde Tavern Spoon Bread
author: Stephanie Holt
summary: Good ol' Southern style spoon bread made with a cornmeal mush which adds extra moistness.
directions: Measure the milk into a saucepan and bring to a boil
Add the cornmeal; cook and stir for several minutes, until cornmeal has absorbed all of the milk
Remove from the heat and allow to cool for about 1 hour
The mixture will be very stiff
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Lightly grease a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish
Place the cornmeal mixture into a large bowl
Stir in the eggs, salt, baking powder and butter
Pour into the prepared casserole dish
Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges become lightly toasted
Serve hot directly from the dish by the spoonful
